title: Merge Bathymetry with DEM data
text: use bathytools package merge bathymetry data DEM raster. package includes example data Lake Rotoma, New Zealand. bathymetry data stored XYZ data.frame .rds file within package. Whereas DEM data stored raster TIF file. DEM raster prepared LiDAR data provided Land Information New Zealand can downloaded . also use shapefile lake shoreline shapefile lake catchment. sourced Freshwater Ecosytems New Zealand database. example lake looking Lake Rotoma Bay Plenty Region North Island Aotearoa New Zealand. lake popular recreational spot fishing boating. tmap package used plot spatial data. tmap_mode("view") function used display map viewer pane RStudio. tmap_options(basemaps = "Esri.WorldImagery") function used set basemap satellite image. similar ggplot2 package, specifically designed spatial data. plot lake shoreline light blue lake catchment pink. depth data stored XYZ format, x y coordinates representing location depth point, z coordinate representing depth meters. depth data stored data.frame .rds file within package. show first rows depth data.
code: library(bathytools) library(tmap) # Used for plotting spatial data shoreline <- readRDS(system.file("extdata/rotoma_shoreline.rds",                                  package = "bathytools")) catchment <- readRDS(system.file("extdata/rotoma_catchment.rds",                                    package = "bathytools")) tmap_mode("view") #> ℹ tmap mode set to "view". tmap_options(basemaps = "Esri.WorldImagery") #> [v3->v4] `tmap_options()`: use basemap.server instead of #> basemaps  tm_shape(shoreline) +   tm_borders(col = "#8DA0CB", lwd = 2) +   tm_shape(catchment) +   tm_borders(col = "#E78AC3", lwd = 2) point_data <- readRDS(system.file("extdata/depth_points.rds",                                   package = "bathytools")) head(point_data) #>        lon       lat  depth #> 1 176.5952 -38.03974  -3.88 #> 2 176.5853 -38.03590 -79.90 #> 3 176.5904 -38.03109 -63.30 #> 4 176.5960 -38.06580  -5.06 #> 5 176.5790 -38.03500 -38.51 #> 6 176.5691 -38.02957 -20.06 dem_raster <- terra::rast(system.file("extdata/dem_32m.tif",                                       package = "bathytools")) tm_shape(dem_raster) +   tm_raster(alpha = 0.5, style = "cont", palette = "-YlGnBu") +   tm_shape(shoreline) +   tm_borders(col = "#FC8D62", lwd = 2) +   tm_shape(catchment) +   tm_borders(col = "#A6D854", lwd = 2)  #>  #> ── tmap v3 code detected ─────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> [v3->v4] `tm_raster()`: instead of `style = "cont"`, use col.scale = #> `tm_scale_continuous()`. #> ℹ Migrate the argument(s) 'palette' (rename to 'values') to #>   'tm_scale_continuous(<HERE>)' #> [v3->v4] `tm_raster()`: use `col_alpha` instead of `alpha`. #> [cols4all] color palettes: use palettes from the R package cols4all. Run #> `cols4all::c4a_gui()` to explore them. The old palette name "-YlGnBu" is named #> "yl_gn_bu" (in long format "brewer.yl_gn_bu")

title: Merge Bathymetry with DEM data
text: first step generate bathymetry raster shoreline depth data. rasterise_bathy() function used generate bathymetry raster. function takes shoreline, depth data, coordinate reference system (CRS) inputs. function returns SpatRaster object representing bathymetry raster.
code: bathy_raster <- rasterise_bathy(shoreline = shoreline,                                 point_data = point_data, crs = 2193,                                 res = 8) #> Generating depth points... [2025-08-11 22:57:58] #> Finished! [2025-08-11 22:57:58] #> Interpolating to raster... [2025-08-11 22:57:58] #> Adjusting depths >= 0 to  -0.82 m #> Finished! [2025-08-11 22:58:00] tm_shape(dem_raster) +   tm_raster(alpha = 0.5, style = "cont", palette = "-YlGnBu") +   tm_shape(bathy_raster) +   tm_raster(style = "cont", palette = "-viridis", breaks = seq(-90, 0, by = 10)) +   tm_shape(shoreline) +   tm_borders(col = "#FC8D62", lwd = 2) +   tm_shape(catchment) +   tm_borders(col = "#A6D854", lwd = 2)  #>  #> ── tmap v3 code detected ─────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> [v3->v4] `tm_raster()`: instead of `style = "cont"`, use col.scale = #> `tm_scale_continuous()`. #> ℹ Migrate the argument(s) 'palette' (rename to 'values') to #>   'tm_scale_continuous(<HERE>)' #> [v3->v4] `tm_raster()`: use `col_alpha` instead of `alpha`. #> [cols4all] color palettes: use palettes from the R package cols4all. Run #> `cols4all::c4a_gui()` to explore them. The old palette name "-YlGnBu" is named #> "yl_gn_bu" (in long format "brewer.yl_gn_bu")

what: Merge the bathymetry with the DEM
title: Merge Bathymetry with DEM data
text: next step merge bathymetry raster DEM raster. merge_bathy_dem() function used merge bathymetry raster DEM raster. function takes shoreline, bathymetry raster, DEM raster, catchment shapefile inputs. function returns SpatRaster object representing merged bathymetry DEM data. resolution bathymetry raster different DEM raster, bathymetry raster resampled match resolution DEM raster.
code: dem_bath <- merge_bathy_dem(shoreline = shoreline, bathy_raster = bathy_raster,                             dem_raster = dem_raster, catchment = catchment) #> Resolutions differ. Resampling bathy_raster to DEM resolution. #> Lake surface elevation from DEM: 313.3 m dem_bath #> class       : SpatRaster  #> size        : 217, 194, 1  (nrow, ncol, nlyr) #> resolution  : 32, 32  (x, y) #> extent      : 1911744, 1917952, 5779472, 5786416  (xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax) #> coord. ref. : NZGD2000 / New Zealand Transverse Mercator 2000 (EPSG:2193)  #> source(s)   : memory #> varname     : dem_32m  #> name        : elevation  #> min value   :  232.0746  #> max value   :  599.1376

previous_headings: Merge the bathymetry with the DEM
what: Spatial plot of the merged raster
title: Merge Bathymetry with DEM data
text: plot merged raster lake catchment boundaries. colours plot clearly distinguish bathymetry DEM data. add break surface elevation lake better distinguish two datasets. can extract water surface elevation DEM data using get_lake_surface_elevation() function. can now plot merged raster lake surface elevation break colour palette.
code: tm_shape(dem_bath) +   tm_raster(alpha = 0.5, style = "cont", palette = "-YlGnBu") +   tm_shape(shoreline) +   tm_borders(col = "#FC8D62", lwd = 2) +   tm_shape(catchment) +   tm_borders(col = "#A6D854", lwd = 2)  #>  #> ── tmap v3 code detected ─────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> [v3->v4] `tm_raster()`: instead of `style = "cont"`, use col.scale = #> `tm_scale_continuous()`. #> ℹ Migrate the argument(s) 'palette' (rename to 'values') to #>   'tm_scale_continuous(<HERE>)' #> [v3->v4] `tm_raster()`: use `col_alpha` instead of `alpha`. #> [cols4all] color palettes: use palettes from the R package cols4all. Run #> `cols4all::c4a_gui()` to explore them. The old palette name "-YlGnBu" is named #> "yl_gn_bu" (in long format "brewer.yl_gn_bu") lake_elev <- get_lake_surface_elevation(dem_raster = dem_raster,                                         shoreline = shoreline) #> Lake surface elevation from DEM: 313.3 m tm_dem_bath(dem_bath = dem_bath, lake_elev = lake_elev)

previous_headings: Merge the bathymetry with the DEM
title: Merge Bathymetry with DEM data
text: hypsograph plot area lake different depths. bathy_to_hypso() function can used generate hypsograph bathymetry raster. function takes bathymetry raster input returns data frame depth area depth. hypsograph can plotted show area lake different depths.
code: hyps <- bathy_to_hypso(bathy_raster = bathy_raster) head(hyps) #>   elev depth     area #> 1    0     0 11243072 #> 2   -1    -1 10497408 #> 3   -2    -2 10217280 #> 4   -3    -3  9998080 #> 5   -4    -4  9798016 #> 6   -5    -5  9605312 library(ggplot2)  ggplot(hyps, aes(x = area, y = depth)) +   geom_line() +   geom_point() +   labs(x = "Area (m^2)", y = "Depth (m)") +   theme_bw()

previous_headings: Merge the bathymetry with the DEM
title: Merge Bathymetry with DEM data
text: plot_raster_3d() function can used create 3-D plot merged raster. function takes merged raster shoreline inputs. fact argument controls aggregation factor raster. higher factor result smoother plot, take longer render.
code: p1 <- plot_raster_3d(x = dem_bath, shoreline = shoreline, split_lake = TRUE) p1

title: Merge Bathymetry with DEM data
text: merged raster can saved file using terra::writeRaster() function. function takes raster object file path inputs. important note SpatRaster can saved “.rds” files. can also quite large, recommended save raster compressed format, GeoTIFF.
code: terra::writeRaster(dem_bath, "dem_bath.tif", overwrite = TRUE)

code: library(bathytools) ## basic example code shoreline <- readRDS(system.file("extdata/rotoma_shoreline.rds",                                  package = "bathytools")) point_data <- readRDS(system.file("extdata/depth_points.rds",                                   package = "bathytools")) bathy <- rasterise_bathy(shoreline = shoreline, point_data = point_data,                          crs = 2193) #> Generating depth points... what: Convert bathymetry raster to hypsograph — bathy_to_hypso
title: Convert bathymetry raster to hypsograph — bathy_to_hypso
text: function converts bathymetry raster hypsograph, data.frame area lake different depths. function takes bathymetry raster input returns data frame depth area depth.

title: Convert bathymetry raster to hypsograph — bathy_to_hypso
code: bathy_to_hypso(bathy_raster, surface = 0, depths = 1)

title: Convert bathymetry raster to hypsograph — bathy_to_hypso
text: bathy_raster SpatRaster object bathymetry depths (negative values). surface numeric. surface elevation lake. Default 0. depths numeric. depths calculate area. single numeric value provided, function calculate area depth surface minimum depth bathymetry raster intervals provided value. vector numeric values provided, function calculate area depth specified vector. Default 1.

title: Convert bathymetry raster to hypsograph — bathy_to_hypso

title: Generate depth points for interpolation — rasterise_bathy
text: shoreline sf object lake shoreline. islands sf object lake islands present. point_data sf object depth points dataframe points columns 'lon' 'lat'. Must contain "depth" column. NULL, contours must provided. NULL, contours must provided. contours sf object depth contours. NULL, points must provided. res numeric resolution output raster metres. subsample logical subsample points 10000 TRUE. Default TRUE. crs target coordinate reference system: object class crs, input string st_crs method character interpolation method. Options 'MBA' (default), print_plot logical print plot interpolated raster. n initial size spline space hierarchical     construction along x axis. rectangular domain     square, n = m = 1 recommended. x axis k times length     y axis, n = 1, m = k recommended. default n = 1. m initial size spline space hierarchical     construction along y axis. y axis k times length     x axis, m = 1, n = k recommended. default m = 1. h Number levels hierarchical construction. , e.g.,     n = m = 1 h = 8, resulting spline surface coefficient     grid size \(2^h\) + 3 = 259 direction     spline surface. See references additional information.
